definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The consensus is that China has a real-estate bubble.
sentences.chinese: 中国的房地产存在着泡沫，这点大家毫无异义。

sentences.english: There are many homonyms, so you have to distinguish.
sentences.chinese: 其中有许多同形异义词，查检使用时须加分辨。

sentences.english: And the one thing he is petrified of is genuine political dissent which he cannot control.
sentences.chinese: 唯一让他吃惊的是他不能控制的真实的政治异义。

sentences.english: This is a kind of research method based upon the primitive"homophonic"relations.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种建立在原始“同音异义”关系上的研究方法。

sentences.english: Two words are homographs if they are spelled the same way but differ in meaning.
sentences.chinese: 拼写相同意思不同的两个单词是同形异义词。

definition: phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
ancient meaning/original or etymological meaning of a word
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
structural particle, such as 的[de5], 地[de5], 得[de5] and 所[suo3]
literary auxiliary particle, comes at the beginning of a sentence
form word/in Classical Chinese, the first character of phrase having auxiliary grammatical function
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
to correct (in writing) sb's errors or misconceptions
